common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS getting stuck on loading screens during onboarding or when accessing demo chats. related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User @hra42 reported an issue with Pieces getting stuck on the loading screen after deleting local database and restarting pOS and PfD.
* The issue was identified as a PERMISSION_DENIED error with Pieces' cloud services.

**Problems Identified:**

* Deleting the local database without also deleting the com.pieces.pfd folder caused issues with onboarding snippets and conversations.
* A permission error prevented Pieces from accessing its cloud services.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* It was suggested to delete both the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folders before restarting pOS and PfD.
* The permission error will require further investigation and resolution by the Pieces team.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user confirmed they deleted both folders and restarted, but the issue persists. The Pieces team is investigating the permission error.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue appears to be specific to existing users who delete their local database.
* The Pieces support team provided links to relevant resources and offered to follow up within 24 hours.

**Overall, the conversation highlights the importance of following proper procedures when deleting the local database and suggests a potential issue with cloud service permissions that requires further attention.**

related_issues.title: FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
related_issues.text:
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Clicking on any link within the Pieces desktop app that required a browser to open up, I would receive the message:
Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window.
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/706ac8c5-b939-4183-af48-ba573901f6ba)

After further review, it does appear that all instances of firefox are spawned under the Pieces OS service:
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/716495d0-b4aa-4bfa-b8d4-d0baf32c8984)

I know that disabling the WorkStream Pattern Engine, this is not an issue. (Assuming I kill off all processes of firefox under that task).


It makes me think that since Pieces OS is hijacking the process, and then firefox is trying to spawn the instance outside of that process, there is a conflict.


My default browser is set to firefox.

I'm running W11.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Firefox instances are spawned as nested processes under the Pieces app on Windows 11.
* This issue only occurs within the 'Pieces for Developers' app.
* The problem started with a fresh install of Pieces and occurs after restarts.
* The issue seems specific to Windows Insider Preview builds.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firefox is not launching as a separate application.
* This could be due to how the OS App is spawning Firefox processes.
* The issue is causing conflicts.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* More information is requested from the user about their system and extensions.
* Debugging in real-time is offered.
* The issue is being investigated.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is reproducible on Windows Insider Preview builds.
* The cause of the problem is still under investigation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is not on a Windows Insider Preview build.
* The 'About Pieces' section incorrectly reports the Windows version as Windows 10 Home.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* OS toolbar failing to launch correctly, possibly when triggered by Visual Studio plugin.
* Toolbar launch attempts from various methods (VS plugin, desktop app, direct launch, restarts) were unsuccessful.
* After updates, applets are unresponsive and Pieces OS restarts unexpectedly.

**Problems Identified:**

* Version 3.0.0 of Visual Studio plugin caused UI thread hang.
* Issue with Pieces OS trying to host applets.
* Dart language SDK not returning OS error code for the applets issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 released to resolve UI hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 released with changes to webview port selection.
* Proposed debugging session to gather more information, including OS error code.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Updates did not resolve Andrea3i's issue.
* Applet unresponsiveness and OS restarts persist.
* Debugging session scheduled to investigate further.

**Additional Notes:**

* The Visual Studio plugin issue seems unrelated to the overall problem.
* Possible causes for the applets issue include lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, permission issues, etc.

**Next Steps:**

* Conduct debugging session to diagnose the root cause of the applets issue.
* Implement a fix based on the findings.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Developer @caleb-at-pieces confirmed the request and added it to their internal project board.
* The feature is expected to be implemented in a future release of Pieces OS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The feature is currently under development and is not yet available. 
* Users can track the progress of the implementation on the project board.

Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

Windows

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* OS toolbar failing to launch correctly, possibly when triggered by Visual Studio plugin.
* Toolbar launch attempts from various methods (VS plugin, desktop app, direct launch, restarts) were unsuccessful.
* After updates, applets are unresponsive and Pieces OS restarts unexpectedly.

**Problems Identified:**

* Version 3.0.0 of Visual Studio plugin caused UI thread hang.
* Issue with Pieces OS trying to host applets.
* Dart language SDK not returning OS error code for the applets issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 released to resolve UI hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 released with changes to webview port selection.
* Proposed debugging session to gather more information, including OS error code.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Updates did not resolve Andrea3i's issue.
* Applet unresponsiveness and OS restarts persist.
* Debugging session scheduled to investigate further.

**Additional Notes:**

* The Visual Studio plugin issue seems unrelated to the overall problem.
* Possible causes for the applets issue include lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, permission issues, etc.

**Next Steps:**

* Conduct debugging session to diagnose the root cause of the applets issue.
* Implement a fix based on the findings.
